cz.syntea.common.cfg

Class MsgX

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.syntea.common.cfg.MsgX

  • public class MsgX
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of the interface to the Syntea projects. NOTE: because Syntea projects doesn't use XML namespace features this class doesn't provide any kind of namespace support.

    This class doesn't provide any kind of namespace support and there are other limitations connected with SYNTEA projects. The user can use those methods AS IT IS without any kind of warranty. The class MsgX implements two different kinds of object which are distinguished by the constructor's parameter mode:

    1. mode = "r": MsgX used for parsing XML source strings. The string given by constructor parameter msg is first parsed and checked according to given XML definition. After the object was created there are available individual components of the parsed result (the DOM object).

    2. mode = "w": MsgX used for composing XML structure. The parameter msg of constructor specifies the name of message and constructor looks for corresponding XML definition. After the object was created there is possible to compose a XML structure. After all parts of XML has been constructed it is possible to check the correctness of created result and to convert it into the string in the XML format.

    The "message" is represented as a XML source string. In the "read" mode the object is first validated and the program throws the exception if the object doesn't pass to the given X-definition. In the "write" mode the message is created with number of various methods and the message can be retrieved with "getMsg" method.

    Example:

    
     File[] file;
     String name;
     ...
     XArchive xar = new DefPool(files);
     X-definition xdef = xar.getDefinition(name);
     ...
     try {
         Msgx xmsg = new MsgX("MyMsg", xdef, MsgX.MODE_WRITE);
         xmsg.putAttribute("Program","TEST");
         xmsg.putAttribute("Description","This is test");
         String msg = xmsg.getMsg();
         //result: <MyMsg Program="TEST" Description= "This is test" />
         ...
         xmsg = new MsgX(msg, xdef, MsgX.MODE_READ);
         String program = xmsg.getAttribute("Program");//TEST
         String description = xmsg.getAttribute("Description"); //This is test
     } catch (SRuntimeException ex) {
         System.err.println("Error " + ex);
     }

    • Field Detail

      • MODE_READ

        public static final java.lang.String MODE_READ
        MODE_READ The parsing mode. String given by constructor is first parsed according to the given XML definition and prepares access to parsed data.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MODE_WRITE

        public static final java.lang.String MODE_WRITE
        MODE_WRITE The constructing mode. The MsgX object is created for "write" (construction) of XML object according to given definition. The name of root element of resulting message is given by parameter msg.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • MsgX

        public MsgX(java.lang.String msg,
            cz.syntea.xdef.XDPool xpool,
            java.lang.String xname,
            java.lang.String mode)
        Create new MsgX object. Parameter msg has different meaning according to value of parameter mode: in the case of "composition" (mode="w") it contains the name of message (tag name of root element); in the case of "read" (mode="r") it contain the source string of message to be parsed.
        Parameters:
        msg - The name of definition or of the source message.
        xpool - XDPool.
        xname - name of X-definition or null.
        mode - The mode: "r" for parsing, "w" for composing.
        Throws:
        cz.syntea.xdef.sys.SRuntimeException - if constructed object doesn't correspond to X-definition.

      • MsgX

        public MsgX(java.lang.String msg,
            cz.syntea.xdef.XDPool xpool,
            java.lang.String xname,
            java.lang.String mode,
            java.io.Writer os,
            java.lang.String encoding,
            boolean writeHdr)
        Create new MsgX object. Parameter msg has different meaning according to value of parameter mode: in the case of "composition" (mode="w") it contains the name of message (tag name of root element); in the case of "read" (mode="r") it contain the source string of message to be parsed.
        Parameters:
        msg - The name of definition or of the source message.
        xpool - XDPool.
        xname - name of X-definition or null.
        mode - The mode: "r" for parsing, "w" for composing.
        os - output writer or null.
        encoding - encoding of output stream or null.
        writeHdr - if XML header should be written to the output stram.
        Throws:
        cz.syntea.xdef.sys.SRuntimeException - if constructed object doesn't correspond to X-definition.

      • getValue

        public static java.lang.Object getValue(cz.syntea.xdef.proc.XXElement base,
                                        java.lang.String xpath)
                                 throws cz.syntea.xdef.sys.SRuntimeException
        Get value specified by xpath. The xpath specification must denote a string (i.e. the attribute or node text value). If given xpath doesn't fit to specified value return null. I result of xpath expression is a set of values the returned value is the first item.
        Parameters:
        base - XXElement where search starts.
        xpath - The xpath to an attribute or a text value.
        Returns:
        The result of xpath expression.
        Throws:
        cz.syntea.xdef.sys.SRuntimeException - the check swith is set on and the attribute is not specified in definition.
